prompt: Generate realistic text messages that represent non-spam (ham) content. These messages should reflect a broad spectrum of everyday communication, including personal conversations, legitimate business or service notifications, casual updates, and automated alerts. Vary the tone (friendly, professional, neutral, concerned), language style (informal chats, formal announcements, concise or detailed), and topics (meeting or appointment reminders, family or friend check-ins, order or delivery confirmations, bank transaction alerts, community or event updates). Include diverse formats like quick one-word replies, detailed explanations, friendly greetings, or automated system messages (e.g., OTP codes, subscription reminders). Ensure the content simulates authentic, non-malicious communication across different contexts, relationships, and platforms, avoiding any deceptive or promotional undertones.
response:
Hey, just checking in to see how your week is going!

Your appointment is confirmed for Thursday at 2 PM. Looking forward to seeing you.

Thanks for your order! It has been shipped and will arrive by Friday.

Can we reschedule our meeting to next week? Let me know what works for you.

Hi Mom, just wanted to let you know I arrived safely!

Your bank statement is now available for download. Please check your account.

Remember, our neighborhood cleanup is this Saturday at 9 AM. Hope to see you there!

Just a reminder that your subscription will renew on the 15th. 

Hey! Are we still on for dinner tonight?

Your OTP is 123456. Please use it to complete your transaction.

I’m running late, but I’ll be there in 15 minutes!

Let me know if you need any help with your project. I’m here for you!

The team meeting is scheduled for Monday at 10 AM. Please be prepared with updates.

Congrats on your promotion! Let’s celebrate soon!

I’ll pick up groceries on my way home. Is there anything specific you need?

Just wanted to remind you about your dentist appointment next Wednesday.

Your package has been delivered! Check your front porch.

I’m really proud of how far you’ve come in your fitness journey!

Please confirm your attendance for the workshop by the end of the day.

I’m so sorry to hear about your loss. I’m here if you need anything.

The event starts at 6 PM. Don’t forget to bring your ID!

Is it okay if I borrow your book for a couple of weeks?

I’ve sent the report. Please let me know if you need any changes.

We missed you at the meeting today. Everything okay?

Your flight has been delayed by two hours. Please check for updates.

Thanks for helping me out yesterday! I really appreciated it.

The kids are excited about the trip this weekend!

I’m here if you want to talk about what’s been bothering you.

Just a quick note to say I’m thinking of you today.

Your feedback survey is ready. We value your input!

Please let me know your availability for next week’s call.

The concert tickets have been booked! Can’t wait!

Your payment was successfully processed. Thank you!

How was your weekend? Let’s catch up soon.

We’re having a potluck at work on Friday. Bring your favorite dish!

I’ll send you the details for the upcoming webinar shortly.

I’m really looking forward to our beach day next month!

Your reminder: the library books are due tomorrow.

Let’s plan a movie night this weekend!

I hope your presentation goes well tomorrow. You’ve got this!

Just a heads up, there’s a traffic jam near downtown.

Can you send me the link to that article we discussed?

Your order is out for delivery and should arrive by 5 PM.

I really enjoyed our chat the other day. Let’s do it again!

Please review the attached document and send me your comments.

Don’t forget, the deadline for submissions is Friday.

I’m at the coffee shop now. What would you like?

Your appointment has been rescheduled to next Tuesday at 3 PM.

I’m thinking of you and hope you’re doing okay.

The fundraiser was a huge success! Thanks for your support!
